songs.full_title: Here Comes Santa Claus by Gene Autry
songs.title: Here Comes Santa Claus

description.plain:
Here Comes Santa Claus is a classic Christmas jingle played around the time of the holiday. It was originally produced by Gene Autry in 1947, and describes Santa Claus coming down his lane (route); giving toys to all the children on Christmas Eve. The song has a strong woodwind use; primarily in the sax and flute, as well as a strong use of keyboard percussion – but most notably, jingle bells constantly ring through the song.

In 1948, the song placed in the top 10 for country music best sellers, and continues to chart yearly during the holiday season.

songs.lyrics:
12 ContributorsHere Comes Santa Claus Lyrics[Verse 1]
Here comes Santa Claus
Here comes Santa Claus
Right down Santa Claus Lane
Vixen and Blitzen and all his reindeers pulling on the reins
Bells are ringing, children singing, all is merry and bright
So hang your stockings and say your prayers
'Cause Santa Claus comes tonight

[Verse 2]
Here comes Santa Claus
Here comes Santa Claus
Right down Santa Claus Lane
He's got a bag that's filled with toys for boys and girls again
Hear those sleigh bells jingle jangle, oh what a beautiful sight
So jump in bed and cover your head
'Cause Santa Claus comes tonight
[Instrumental break]

[Verse 3]
Here comes Santa Claus
Here comes Santa Claus
Right down Santa Claus Lane
He doesn't care if you're rich or poor
He loves you just the same
Santa Claus knows we're all God's children
That makes everything right
So fill your hearts with Christmas cheer
'Cause Santa Claus comes tonight

[Verse 4]
Here comes Santa Claus
Here comes Santa Claus
Right down Santa Claus Lane
He'll come around when chimes ring out that it's Christmas morn' again
Peace on Earth will come to all if we just follow the light
So let's give thanks to the lord above
'Cause Santa Claus comes tonight

[Instrumental break]

[Verse 5]
Here comes Santa Claus
Here comes Santa Claus
Right down Santa Claus Lane
Vixen and Blitzen and all his reindeers pulling on the reins
Bells are ringing, children singing, all is merry and bright
Hang your stockings and say your prayers
'Cause Santa Claus comes tonightYou might also like1Embed

songs.full_title: Red River Valley by Gene Autry
songs.title: Red River Valley

description.plain:
“Red River Valley” is a traditional western folk song, and probably originated in Canada sometime around 1879.

Speculation on the impetus of the song focuses on the Wolseley Expedition to the northern Red River Valley of Manitoba in 1870.



The song appears in the 1927 Carl Sanburg book, American Songbag, and is listed in the Western Writers of America Top 100 Western Songs.

The version included here appeared in the 1936 Gene Autry movie of the same name.

songs.full_title: Red River Valley by Traditional Folk Song
songs.title: Red River Valley

songs.lyrics:
2 ContributorsRed River Valley LyricsFrom this valley they say you are goin'
I will miss your bright eyes and sweet smile
For they say you are takin' the sunshine
That has brightened our pathway the while

Do you think of the valley you're leavin'
Oh how lonely and dreary it will be
Do you think of the fond heart you're breakin'
And the sadness you've cast over me

For a long time my dear, I've been waiting
For the words that you never would say
And alas my poor heart you are breakin'
For they tell me you're goin' away
As you go to your home by the ocean
May you never forget those sweet hours
That we spent in the Red River Valley
And the love we exchanged mid the flowers

Come and sit by my side if you love me
Do not hasten to bid me adieu
But remember the Red River Valley
And the one that has loved you so trueYou might also likeEmbed

songs.full_title: You Are My Sunshine by Jimmie Davis
songs.title: You Are My Sunshine

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsYou Are My Sunshine LyricsYou are my sunshine, my only sunshine
You make me happy when skies are grey
You'll never know dear, how much I love you
Please don't take my sunshine away

The other night dear, as I lay sleeping
I dreamt I held you in my arms
When I awoke, dear, I was mistaken
So I hung my head and cried

You are my sunshine, my only sunshine
You make me happy when skies are grey
You'll never know dear, how much I love you
Please don't take my sunshine away
I'll always love you and make you happy
If you will only say the same
But if you leave me to love another
You'll regret it all some day

You are my sunshine, my only sunshine
You make me happy when skies are grey
You'll never know dear, how much I love you
Please don't take my sunshine away

You told me once dear, you really loved me
And no one else dear, could come between
But now you've left me and love another
You have shattered all my dreams

You are my sunshine, my only sunshine
You make me happy when skies are grey
You'll never know dear, how much I love you
Please don't take my sunshine awayYou might also like4Embed
